pullRequest.title: Patches for Http2
pullRequest.bodyText:
Provided an initializer when stream channel is created. This allows setup pipeline first and then return stream to claimer. Without this, it may face a timing issue that claimer try to take action on pipeline but pipeline is empty.
Add metrics and logs for request to drop.
Polish releaseAndCloseStreamChannel.
Set REQUEST_INFO to null whenever possible to reduce reference to object.

commit.message: share handlers as much as possible

nodes.bodyText: Maybe make this handler a static class in Http2BlockingChannel (or its own file like the other handlers) since most of the logic is about how the netty pipeline interacts with that class

+import io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf;
+import io.netty.channel.ChannelHandlerContext;
+import io.netty.channel.SimpleChannelInboundHandler;
+import io.netty.handler.codec.http.FullHttpResponse;
+import io.netty.util.concurrent.Promise;
+
+
+/**
+ * Netty handler for {@link Http2BlockingChannel} to handle {@link FullHttpResponse}.
+ */
+public class Http2BlockingChannelResponseHandler extends SimpleChannelInboundHandler<FullHttpResponse> {

nodes.bodyText: Looks like AmbrySendToHttp2Adaptor is marked shareable, but a new instance is being created for each channel
why include the hashcode in this log message?
why is the http2ClientConfig passed in from the constructor not used here?

nodes.bodyText: nit: you might be able to use releaseAndCloseStreamChannel in warmUpConnections too.
nit: since the http2ClientMetrics is not used in this class, we don't need to have a reference of this object in this class.

nodes.bodyText: hmm, Do we have to add a responseInfo to the queue when writeAndFlush failed?
we should use getAndSet(null) here to release the reference as well.
